solution.text:
Horse can travel in a circle of radius=length of the rope
\(\Rightarrow r=_{k}_\)
\(Now\,area \,of\,a \,sector=\pi \times r^2 \times \frac {\theta}{360}\)
In a squared shaped field\(\theta = 90^\circ\)
sector area\(=\frac {22}7\times _{k}_^2 \times \frac {90}{360}\)
\(\Rightarrow area=_{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*90/360,2)}}_\)
grazing speed of the horse = \(_{j}_m^2/min\)
therefore, \(time\, taken=\frac {area\,grazed}{speed}=_{{trunc(pi_val*k*k/(4*j),2)}}_\,minutes\)

content.text:
Horse is grazing in a square field at a rate of \(_{j}_m^2/min\)
If it is tied to a peg at one corner of the grass field of side _{{k*2}}_m by means of a _{k}_ m rope,
find the time taken by the horse to finish the maximum area it could graze
